I am renting a shared hosting web server. I can't use a crontab (no permissions), the server only allows some scheduler
and not at the exact time & frequency I want my "signals", so I wrote a little c++ prog which basically sleeps the right amount of time
sounds like a kludge on top of a mess
then wakes up to do its stuff and sleeps again until the next time. It detects if there is a "more recent" instance of itself running and shuts down in that case
the script is basically going in the right directory and launching "test &"
try "exec test"
exec spawns it off as a separate process allowing the shell to close
just "exec test" or "exec test &"
I thought the "&" at the end of the command was meant for this
but the shell still has to stay open. if you background a process and close the shell, the process ends. (unless you use "nohup" which intercepts SIGHUP)
im just throwing ideas out there for what may make a difference in behaviour
